content: As an AI language model, I cannot determine the exact actions of ammonites, but since they are extinct sea creatures that lived millions of years ago, it is currently impossible to observe their behavior directly. However, it is believed that ammonites used their shells for buoyancy and movement through the water. The shells were divided into chambers, with the living animal occupying the final chamber, and the others were filled with gas. By regulating the amount of gas within the chambers, the ammonites could control their buoyancy and remain at a particular water depth. Additionally, the shape of their shells may have aided in movement through the water, allowing them to swim or float around more efficiently.
